page.title: 01SUMMARY- RODE AND SOUTHWICK.
page.content: This area, straddling the Wiltshire/ Somerset border is agricultural. It is a very pleasant place to live. The land rises gently from the river Frome towards the villages of Rode and Southwick but rises steeply towards Tellisford. These three villages are the main centres of population. They are quite different in character. Southwick is largest, with many modern homes and young families. Rode is a very old village, with some new houses. It is a lively place with many activites for all age groups. Tellisford is a small, very old village, with few public facilities. Most people are employed in the surrounding towns of Trowbridge Frome, Bath, Westbury and Warminster. We have attempted in these pages to describe the area and the life of the people of the villages.
